-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Please see the README on GitHub at
--   <a>https://github.com/SebTee/how-monochromatic#readme</a>
@package how-monochromatic
@version 0.1.0.0


-- | Library for handling bi-coloured graphs
module BCG

-- | Bi-Colored Graph
data BCG
BCG :: [BCE] -> IntSet -> Int -> BCG

-- | Bi-Coloured Edge
data BCE
BCE :: Int -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Complex Double -> BCE

-- | From Vertex
[fromV] :: BCE -> Int

-- | From Colour
[fromC] :: BCE -> Int

-- | To Vertex
[toV] :: BCE -> Int

-- | To Colour
[toC] :: BCE -> Int

-- | Weight
[w] :: BCE -> Complex Double

-- | Inherited Vertex Coloring
type IVC = Set (Int, Int)

-- | Perfect Matching
type PM = BCG

-- | A <a>BCG</a> with no edges or vertices and the number of different
--   colors is 0
empty :: BCG

-- | Return a value between 0 and 1 representing a <a>BCG</a>'s distance to
--   the monochromatic &lt;math&gt; Where &lt;math&gt; is an <a>IVC</a> on
--   &lt;math&gt;, &lt;math&gt; is the number of different colors on
--   &lt;math&gt; and &lt;math&gt; is the colouring weight of &lt;math&gt;.
dist :: BCG -> Double

-- | Get a list of perfect matchings on a <a>BCG</a> The perfect matchings
--   are represented by the <a>BCG</a> data type
enumeratePM :: BCG -> [BCG]

-- | Get a list of <a>BCE</a>s connected to a vertex
getIncidentEdges :: BCG -> Int -> [BCE]

-- | Determines if a vertex is connected to an <a>BCE</a>
isIncident :: Int -> BCE -> Bool

-- | Removes a <a>BCE</a> from a <a>BCG</a> and the vertices it was
--   incident to
removeEdgeAndIncidentVertices :: BCG -> BCE -> BCG

-- | Removes a vertex and the connected <a>BCE</a>s from a <a>BCG</a>
removeVertex :: BCG -> Int -> BCG

-- | Removes a list of vertices and their connected <a>BCE</a>s from a
--   <a>BCG</a>
removeVertices :: BCG -> [Int] -> BCG

-- | Checks if all edges on a <a>PM</a> are monochromatic and have the same
--   color
isMonochromatic :: PM -> Bool

-- | Takes a list of <a>PM</a>s with the same <a>IVC</a> and returns the
--   <a>IVC</a>'s weight
coloringWeight :: [PM] -> Complex Double

-- | Get the <a>IVC</a> of a <a>PM</a>
pmsIvc :: PM -> IVC

-- | Groups a list of <a>PM</a>'s by <a>IVC</a>
groupByIvc :: [PM] -> [[PM]]

-- | Check if 2 vertices are adjacent
isAdjacent :: BCG -> Int -> Int -> Bool

-- | Get a set of adjacent nodes
getAdjacent :: BCG -> Int -> IntSet

-- | get list of vertices connected to a vertex on a <a>BCG</a>
getConnected :: BCG -> Int -> IntSet

-- | Determine if a given <a>BCG</a> is a fully connected graph
isConnectedGraph :: BCG -> Bool

-- | Counts the number of different colors on a <a>BCG</a>
numberDifferentColors :: BCG -> Int
instance GHC.Show.Show BCG.BCE
instance GHC.Show.Show BCG.BCG


-- | Library for parsing strings into <a>BCG</a>
module ParseBCG

-- | Parse a string into <a>BCG</a> Each line of the string represents an
--   edge. Each line is made up of 6 elements in a specific order separated
--   by spaces. The elements are
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>vertex_id_0</li>
--   <li>colour_id_0</li>
--   <li>vertex_id_1</li>
--   <li>colour_id_1</li>
--   <li>weight_real_part</li>
--   <li>weight_imaginary_part</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <b>Example</b>
--   
--   <pre>
--   1 green 2 green 1 0
--   1 blue  3 blue  1 0
--   1 red   4 green 0 1
--   1 red   6 red   1 0
--   2 red   3 red   1 0
--   2 blue  5 blue  1 0
--   3 green 4 green 1 0
--   3 green 6 red   0 1
--   4 red   5 red   1 0
--   4 red   6 green 0 1
--   4 blue  6 blue  1 0
--   5 green 6 green 1 0
--   </pre>
--   
parse :: String -> Either (ParseException, Int) BCG

-- | Exceptions returned by the parser
data ParseException

-- | The line has an incorrect number of parameters
IncorrectNumberOfParameters :: ParseException

-- | The real or imaginary part of the complex number couldn't be parsed
--   into <a>Double</a>
ComplexNumberParseFailure :: ParseException
instance GHC.Show.Show ParseBCG.ParseException
instance GHC.Show.Show ParseBCG.BCEToken
